overview_summary: None of these three neighboring landowners have a documented public stance on the proposed development (all noted stances are unknown). All own rural land in Lee County, and while one family has a history of local civic roles, the others have low public profiles and influence.

neighbors.name: Cecil W. Watkins Jr.
neighbors.claims: Cecil W. Watkins Jr. is listed as the owner of a rural Lee County parcel (PIN 024-00-00-047-000) in an area where farming is a dominant land use [WIS News](https://www.wistv.com/2023/03/23/county-budgets-expected-reap-massive-revenue-gains-solar-farms-if-projects-are-completed/). The Watkins family has longstanding local ties; for example, a Ben E. Watkins served on the Lee County Council in the early 1990s [Justia](https://law.justia.com/cases/south-carolina/supreme-court/1992/23652-2.html).

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a well-known local farmer or community leader approach him, emphasizing respect for his family’s land legacy and explaining how the project can support farmland preservation.

neighbors.name: Guy C. Smith et al.
neighbors.claims: Guy C. Smith (with other co-owners) is associated with a Lee County property (PIN 025-00-00-021-000), and his name appears in numerous property records for the area [RealtyHop](https://www.realtyhop.com/property-records/search/guy-c-smith). There are no indications in available public sources that Smith has taken any public position or spoken out on local development issues (searches yielded only unrelated references) [Yahoo News](https://news.yahoo.com/solar-farms-spark-tension-between-100000229.html).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage through a neighborly introduction or local farming network, focusing on how the project can coexist with and even benefit long-term farm use of the land.

neighbors.name: James Edward Tolbert
neighbors.claims: James Edward Tolbert is listed as the owner of a parcel in Lee County (PIN 024-00-00-133-000), likely agricultural land given the county’s farming profile [WIS News](https://www.wistv.com/2023/03/23/county-budgets-expected-reap-massive-revenue-gains-solar-farms-if-projects-are-completed/). No public statements or documented views on development by Tolbert were found in local records (name searches returned no relevant results) [Yahoo News](https://news.yahoo.com/solar-farms-spark-tension-between-100000229.html).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach him in a one-on-one conversation via a mutual local acquaintance, addressing any concerns about protecting his farmland and ensuring minimal disruption to his quiet rural lifestyle.
